attributes.action: Lower the percentage before Child Maintenance will accept a change of income.
attributes.additional_details: This has happened to many parents including myself. My wage dropped by ten thousand however this was not enough as it does not breach the 25%. My payments should have dropped from £320 to £210 but they never. I totally agree with having Child Maintenance but let's at least make it fair for both parents.
attributes.background: CMS operate a 25% rule.They will not consider a change of income unless it breaches this 25%. So if your income changes from £41000 to £31000 your payments will still be calculated on £41000 as you miss the 25% by £250. So you would continue to pay £300 a month instead of the £230 it should be.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 
 
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We understand you're concerned about the 25% rule but we're not sure how you'd like to change it. In particular we don't know if you'd like to remove the 25% rule altogether or to lower the percentage.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
